laboratory_examinations.findings: Elevation of CRP levels associated with higher near-term all-cause and cardiovascular mortality.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CRP levels showed an increasing relative risk for death within 1 year (1.13) and between 1 to 2 years (1.15).

laboratory_examinations.findings: Higher levels of D-dimer associated with increased mortality in patients with PAD.
Higher serum amyloid A levels associated with increased all-cause mortality.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Relative risk for death between 1 and 2 years was 1.13.

laboratory_examinations.findings: JAK2 V617F found in approximately 50% of DNA from atrial and ventricular cardiomyocytes.
Conventional ELISA was reactive for HIV; Western blot too weak to be reported as positive.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient had repeatedly false-negative rapid HIV test results despite classical AIDS presentation.
